title: In-class Exercise 2
text:
Required packages are installed using the code chunk below.

pacman::p_load(sf, tidyverse)

This import shapefile of mpsz 2014

mpsz2014 = st_read(dsn = "data", 
                  layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")

Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\ryanpxp\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21


Check if class is data.frame

class(mpsz2014)

[1] "sf"         "data.frame"


Importing kml file of mpsz2014

st_write(mpsz2014, "data/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml", delete_dsn = TRUE)

Deleting source `data/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing layer `MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML' to data source 
  `data/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing 323 features with 15 fields and geometry type Multi Polygon.



mpsz2014_kml = st_read(dsn = "data/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml")

Reading layer `MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML' from data source 
  `C:\ryanpxp\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data\MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84


This import shapefile of mpsz 2019

mpsz2019 = st_read(dsn = "data", 
                  layer = "MPSZ-2019")

Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `C:\ryanpxp\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84


Check if class is data.frame

class(mpsz2019)

[1] "sf"         "data.frame"


Importing kml file of mpsz2019

mpsz2019_kml = st_read(dsn = "data/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml")

Reading layer `MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML' from data source 
  `C:\ryanpxp\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data\MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84


Handling Coordinate System
check coordinate system

st_crs(mpsz2019)

Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: WGS 84 
  wkt:
GEOGCRS["WGS 84",
    DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984",
        ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
    PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
        ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
    CS[ellipsoidal,2],
        AXIS["latitude",north,
            ORDER[1],
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
        AXIS["longitude",east,
            ORDER[2],
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
    ID["EPSG",4326]]


Transform coordinate system

mpsz2014 <- st_read(dsn = "data", 
                  layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)

Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\ryanpxp\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21



mpsz2019 <- st_read(dsn = "data", 
                  layer = "MPSZ-2019") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)

Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `C:\ryanpxp\IS415-GAA\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84


working with pop data

popdata <- read.csv("data/respopagesextod2023.csv")

data wrangling

popdata2023 <- popdata %>% 
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>% 
  summarise(`POP`=sum(`Pop`)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = AG, 
              values_from = POP)

`summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.

colnames(popdata2023)

 [1] "PA"          "SZ"          "0_to_4"      "10_to_14"    "15_to_19"   
 [6] "20_to_24"    "25_to_29"    "30_to_34"    "35_to_39"    "40_to_44"   
[11] "45_to_49"    "50_to_54"    "55_to_59"    "5_to_9"      "60_to_64"   
[16] "65_to_69"    "70_to_74"    "75_to_79"    "80_to_84"    "85_to_89"   
[21] "90_and_Over"


data processing

popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate(`YOUNG` = rowSums(.[3:6]) + rowSums(.[14])) %>%
  mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:13])+rowSums(.[15])) %>%
  mutate(`AGED` = rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
  mutate(`TOTAL` = rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%
  mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`)/`ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
  select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`, `ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`, `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)


popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ), 
            .funs = list(toupper)) 


mpsz_pop2023 <- left_join(mpsz2019, popdata2023, 
                          by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))

mpsz_pop2023

Simple feature collection with 332 features and 12 fields
